p: Orlando strain Aedes aegypti females were reared according to standard procedures utilized by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) [ 15]. Pupae were provided by the USDA prior to experiments. Pupae were allowed to eclose in 20.3 × 20.3 × 20.3 cm cages (Bioquip, Inc., Rancho Dominguez, CA, USA) and provided 10% sucrose water ad libitum prior to experiments. Mosquitoes were kept in incubators (Darwin Chambers, St. Louis, MO, USA) maintained at 28 °C ± 75% humidity with a 12:12 light dark cycle. Only non-blood-fed adult females were used for each experiment, and treated individuals ranged from 2–7 days old [ 16].
